result.execSummary:
The defendant Manuel A. Guizar was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Manuel A. Guizar is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Manuel A. Guizar was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Manuel A. Guizar was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Manuel A. Guizar was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: All counts Concurrent to each other but Consecutive to 93CF272.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State. DE appears in custody with Atty Brenda Van Cuick.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES: 229 - Amended information filed. DE enters pleas of guilty as to amended Cts 2, 3 - found guilty by the court. DE enters plea of no contest as to amended Ct 4 - found guilty by the court. Amended Ct 1 dismissed outright. Sentence recommendations. Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 1 year w/conditions - all counts concurrent to each other but consecutive to 93CF272 revocation. Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given. Court costs ordered.  No restitution requested.  Appeal rights given.
